Hahaha. Had an awesome time with everyone here answering questions. My free 7 day challenge and info on The Plant Fed Gut Masterclass is all available at

https://theplantfedgut.com/

Thanks for hanging with me and having some fun!

node.text:
Tomorrow we launch The Plant Fed Gut Masterclass with new recipes from Chef @lauren_kretzer . During our live, we discussed veganism, the motivation to eat more plants, the strategies that have worked for us, and our tips to encourage making changes to a more plant-centered diet.

It was an awesome conversation!

#plantbased #plantbaseddiet #wfpb #vegan #veganfood #guthealth

node.text:
Y’all are gonna love ❤️ this book!

THE PLANT-BASED ATHLETE

by Robert Cheeke & Matt Frazier

This is a book 📚 for everyone. It fills a much needed niche in the literary world with knowledge that will empower you to take your health to a whole new level and reach a new peak performance.

Grab your copy TODAY! It’s on sale on Amazon, and who knows how long that price will be available.

Make sure to follow @robert.cheeke @veganbodybuildingandfitness @nomeatathlete_official 
.
.
.
.
.
#fitness #fitnessnutrition #plantbased #plantbaseddiet #plantbasedrecipes #veganfitness #peakperformance

node.text:
Women’s Hormones
Women’s Cycles
Women’s Health

HORMONE INTELLIGENCE is a book of empowerment with life changing knowledge. I think you will absolutely love this interview between @dr.avivaromm and I. Grab your copy of HORMONE INTELLIGENCE today. Learn more at:
https://avivaromm.com/book/

I’m also super excited to share that Dr. Aviva is one of the featured experts in my upcoming The Plant Fed Gut Masterclass that launches on May 28th.  It’s a seven week journey to empower yourself with the knowledge to optimize your gut and feel your best.

The summer of 2021 could be about empowering yourself with knowledge about health that transforms your life. Grab this book and join us in the course and we will be having fun for weeks to come together.

Learn more about the course at:
https://theplantfedgut.com/
.
.
.
.
.
#hormoneintelligence #womenshealth #avivaromm #womenshormones #hormonehealth #guthealth

The world needs this book! No matter who you are and what your dietary preference is, I’m sure we can all agree — we want our kids to eat more fruits and veggies.

FINALLY we have the book that will help us to do that:

The Plant-Based Baby & Toddler by Alex Caspero & Whitney English from @plantbasedjuniors 

50 recipes, all your questions answered, easy to digest format. This is the best resource for raising healthy, thriving plant-based kids.

node.text:
It happened! My friend Simon Hill from @plant_proof released his first book and it’s an absolute page turner.

THE PROOF IS IN THE PLANTS

Think nutrition is confusing? You are not alone. Tons of people feel that way, and this is the book that’s going to demystify it for you. It’s broken into three parts:
1 - Why we’re confused (It all starts to make sense when you read about why)
2 - What does the science say about food choices and obesity, heart disease, cancer, brain health, longevity and planetary health? You’re going to find out in Part 2.
3 - Core principles to live by. Simon breaks it down with 8 key rules to keep in mind for optimal health. I absolutely love this section.

My friends, THE PROOF IS IN THE PLANTS is a phenomenal book and I hope that every one of you reads it because it’s rock solid and will help explain so much of what’s happening out there in the diet wars and internet confusion.

As an added bonus, Simon is donating 100% of the proceeds to charity. They’ve calculated that every book sold will protect about 2 square meters of forest. That’s a huge amount of space. What happens if 100,000 of us buy this book? Think about that. You’re literally making a difference by simply ordering a copy.

🌱🪴🌱🎍🌱🪴🌱

THE PROOF IS IN THE PLANTS is available everywhere books are sold in Australia 🇦🇺 and through Book Depository if you are outside Australia! Buy your copy today!

https://www.bookdepository.com/Proof-is-Plants-Simon-Hill/9781760890049?ref=grid-view&qid=1620058852106&sr=1-1

node.text:
Had such a blast with my friend @jessicamurnane discussing her new book @knowyourendo . This is the book I will be recommending to my patients with #endometriosis .

https://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/0593189833/ref=tmm_pap_swatch_0?ie=UTF8&qid=1619739706&sr=8-3

node.title: Jessica Murnane, author of Know Your Endo

node.text:
Such a great time talking about raising healthy kids and family culture with @dranamariatemple !!!

Make sure to grab her book The Rule of 5 off Amazon. It’s an amazing deal!

https://www.amazon.com/Rule-Parents-Raising-Healthy-Unhealthy/dp/1735622206

node.title: Live with Dr. Ana-Maria Temple to discuss raising healthy kids!

node.title: Cleaning Up The Mental Mess with Dr. Caroline Leaf

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Will Bulsiewicz MD MSCI (Dr B) on July 21, 2021. May be an image of food and text that says 'LET'S GET THE STORY STRAIGHT ON SOY AN @THEGUTHEALTHMD INVESTIGATION'.

node.text:
Let’s get the record straight on SOY, estrogen, and man boobs.

There’s a lot of information out there. Soy seems to be polarizing, with strong feelings on both sides. Why is everything so polarizing these days??? (*cough* social media *cough*)

Some folks seem to be under the impression that soy contains estrogen because it contains phytoestrogens. So prep yourselves for THIS truth bomb💣:

Phytoestrogens are NOT estrogen. NOR do they function the same as human estrogen.

But actuallllllly, phytoestrogens are isoflavones. 

There are three soy isoflavones: genistein, daidzein, and glycitein. These complex plant compounds offer an impressive array of health benefits: reducing cholesterol, fortifying bones, relieving menopausal symptoms, and lowering the risk of cardiovascular disease and some cancers (breast/ovarian/prostate/colon).

PLUS, certain gut bacteria can convert soy isoflavones into equol, a supercharged isoflavone, giving you even more cardiovascular, bone, and menopausal support. 

FYI: Not everyone gets access to equol, but I drop tips in #FIBERFUELED to give your microbes that sweeeet hook up. 🙌

What’s the evidence that soy gives you man boobs??? Okay, here goes -- a single case report from 2008. (PMID 18558591) 

So you’re telling me I have to spend all this time explaining that soy DOES NOT cause man boobs based upon the research equivalent of “My uncle smoked 2 packs and drank a twelver everyday and lived to 100”? Meanwhile literally billions of people in east Asia are smashing soy 👏 EVERY 👏 SINGLE 👏 DAY 👏 without man boobs.

SOY DOES NOT CAUSE MAN BOOBS!!!

Sorry for the outburst.

Anyways, soy comes in different forms in your supermarket. I think distinguishing the different types is part of understanding the nuance and not being lazy in our conversation on whether soy is good or bad.

Soy chicken nuggets/tofurkey? Weird.
Edamame/tofu/miso/tempeh/unsweetened soy milk? Awesome.

Always organic and in its whole food form for me.

Soy lovers, back me up. What’s your favorite soy food and do you have man boobs???
.
.

node.text:
Give me a DOUBLE TAP ❤️‍🔥 if you’ve ever felt like you’re drowning in rules.

Yeah, me too.😬

Keeping it real -- yes, rules are important. Especially the ones handed to Moses on stone tablets or anything that’s a felony.

But last I checked, the Ten Commandments don’t include dietary advice and eating a piece of cake isn’t a felony.

I’m NOT advocating for you to view all food the same or encouraging you to chase junkfood. But I DO want you to have a healthy relationship with food, and that’s simply not going to be the case when you have food fear, anxiety, stress, guilt, or disappointment brought on by food.

FOOD👏🏻IS👏🏻MEANT👏🏻TO👏🏻BE👏🏻ENJOYED!

I’ve always wanted to do the clap thing. 😂 I see other people doing it, and find it amusing. So there it is...

Anyway, let’s find our personal BALANCE.⚖️ Rules that create food fear, stress, or a rift in our relationship with food need to be replaced by something more gentle. On the flip side, rules that give structure and help us be a better version of ourself are good though!

You have to figure out what works best FOR YOU. Ultimately, I believe you will be at your best when you are enjoying your food, you free yourself from guilt and do your best, you celebrate progress, you ignore perfection, you eat more plants in abundance and variety, and you laugh at my Dad jokes. Those are general guidelines. NOT RULES!!!😂

You with me?

Hopefully this is the vibe you picked up in my book FIBER FUELED. I wanted to create a resource filled with recommendations and guidelines to help you live a healthier life— without bombarding you with rules and regulations and should’s.

You do you, baby boo. Figure out what works best on your end. Just make sure you’re drinking some water and not drowning in it, you feel me?

PS - How great was The Shining? That movie STILL rocks.

What’s your favorite Jack Nicholson role or movie??? I loved him as the 🃏.

node.text:
SHARE THIS POST!// What’s up, y’all?! Let’s chat about some top notch power couples— and no I’m not talking about #Bennifer.

You’ve definitely heard me talk about some of these before— and if you’ve read #FIBERFUELED you know there are plenty more— but I want to highlight these three specific combos today.

First up? Tomato 🍅 & Avocado 🥑: Tomatoes are rich in lycopene, which reduces the risk of cancer and cardiovascular disease. Fats, which are the avocado’s specialty, make the lycopene more bioavailable. So treat yourself to that extra guac 😉

Next: Kale & Lemon. 🍋 Kale is a plant-based source of iron, which is non-heme and less bioavailable. Heme iron comes from animal sources and has been said to be associated with coronary artery disease, colon cancer, and type-2 diabetes. Instead, get your iron fix by pairing your kale with Vitamin C-rich lemon, which swoops in and cranks up iron absorption big time. 🙌 

And finally: Turmeric & Black Pepper. Curcumin is the active ingredient in turmeric. It’s a potent anti-inflammatory that works wonders for people with joint pain and other similar ailments. By sprinkling the black pepper on your turmeric-infused meal (like a curry!), you increase the bioavailability of curcumin by 2000%! 

So not only are these foods powerful individually, but when combined with their trusty sidekick, they become unstoppable. 🙌 🙌 🙌 

What food combos are you loving right now?
.
.
#fiberfueled #diversityofplants #eattherainbow #plants #plantbased #guthealth #guthealthmatters #guthealing #vegan #vegetarian #powercouples #powerfoods

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Will Bulsiewicz MD MSCI (Dr B) on July 12, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of 1 person and text that says 'Will Bulsiewicz @theguthealthmd We have a new generation of bacteria in our guts every 20 minutes. While you read Instagram, they make babies.'.

node.text:
All life on this planet has superpowers. 🦸🏼‍♀️Our gut microbes have MULTIPLE. I’ll share one in this post, but first…

🥳Story Time with Dr. B!🥳

When I was in high school, my younger brother Steak 🥩(yes, I’m a vegan with a younger brother nicknamed Steak 🥩) had a series of attempted business ventures. He’s the serial entrepreneur in the family.

Anyway, Beanie Babies went off trend and their value plummeted, so Steak moved on to open a gerbil 🐹 business.

The idea: Sell gerbils to the local pet stores and GET RICH!💰💰

It didn’t work out. Here’s why:
1. Pet stores don’t sell a ton of gerbils.😒
2. They’re a low ticket pet, so stores only pay about a dollar for them.🙁
3. Gas costs more than you make selling gerbils.😤
4. Gerbils have active love lives. They’re constantly making babies.😳😳

We were soon over run with gerbils at our household. Completely dominated. They broke us.🐹🐹🐹

Efficient procreation is a gerbilian superpower.

Guess what…  Procreation is a microbial superpower too! It’s called fission — one microbe splits into two. But this can actually happen every 20 minutes!

So in the last hour, some of the microbes in your gut that were the children have become the great grandparents.

Potentially 72 new generations of microbes every 24 hours.

And this is why in David et al, Nature 2014, they showed that your gut microbiome starts to change just 24 hours after you switch up your diet. Your dietary choices get amplified because when you alter conditions in the gut, you shift the balance of multiple generations of microbes in a short period of time.

This is just ONE of the many fun and exciting topics that I discussed with my friend Karalynne Call on the @just.ingredients podcast.

Check it out, let me know what you think of it, and if you love it give it a share-a-rooski and tag me and @just.ingredients
https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/just-ingredients/id1557557205?i=1000528090777

I think my superpower is taking boring, complicated stuff and teaching it in a way that’s fun and simple.🦸🏻‍♂️

What’s your superpower?🤔🤔
.
.
.
.
#guthealth #gutmicrobiome #gutmicrobiota #podcasts #podcast

I’m always honored by the compliments I get on my smoothie bowls. They’re really so easy to do. Let me show you how. Save this post to come back to it and tag me in your smoothie bowl posts and stories so I can see them!

SMOOTHIE BASE RECIPE

node.text:
Happy National Blueberry Day! I’m going to let you in on a little secret 🤫

Small wild blueberries are where it’s AT. 🙌

Believe it or not, they’re packed with more antioxidants than the bigger ones!

And here’s another one of my favorite facts: Blueberries are blue because of a phytochemical called anthocyanins. They’re green until the anthocyanins come in. To be honest, they’re kind of incredible. Studies have shown that anthocyanins protect against cancer and also boost cognition. 

You also may have heard of the study where women who ate one serving of blueberries 🫐 or two servings of strawberries 🍓 delayed cognitive decline and made their brains behave as though they were 30 months younger! (BTW this study was referenced in Chapter 8 of #FIBERFUELED - PMID: 22535616).
But wait— there’s more! 😂

The fiber content of blueberries is not to be overlooked. In a one-cup serving of blueberries, you’ll find 4 grams of fiber. If you eat a few handfuls every day, you’re significantly upping your fiber intake which, when you think about it, is pretty major. 🙌 

Moral of the story? Don’t sleep on the little wild blueberries. They may be less sweet, but they pack a punch of vitamins, nutrients, and flavor that can’t be beat.

Okay okay I’m stepping off my soapbox now to go rummage through my fridge for some bluebs. Y’all with me?!

Bluebs….

Hypothetical: What happens if I eat 10 servings of bluebs? Does that shave 300 months off my brain, making me 15 again? Asking for a friend. Maybe I’ll just go 5 servings to get back to 28. Not sure I really want to be 15 again, tbh.
.
.
#FiberFueled #DiversityOfPlants #EatTheEainbow #plants #PlantBased #GutHealth #GutHealthMatters #GutHealing #vegan #vegetarian #blueberries

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Will Bulsiewicz MD MSCI (Dr B) on July 07, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'TIPS FOR MINDFUL EATING: @theguthealthmd Sit down at an actual table Phones away! Observe your food Taste your food Chew your food'.

node.text:
Sounds like common sense, right?

But consider this: Last time you ate in the presence of a toddler, did you remind them to “CHEW CHEW CHEW, TINY PIECES, NICE AND SLOW!” ?!?!?!

If you’re anything like me, the answer is a definite yes. Uncle Will gets all up in their face. What can I say, I want to see these kids succeed… 😂

I’m not going to get all up in your face, but I want to see you succeed too.

So many of us are back on-the-go at parties, bbqs, happy hours, which means less time for chewing our food.

More freedom = more to do = less time for meals

With that in mind, I figured it was time for a summertime reminder of one of my favorite phrases:

Hara hachi bu. 🙌🙌🙌

It means eat until you’re 80% full, then STOP. 🛑

I learned this from @danbuettner -- the legend behind the @bluezones projects.

I know that sometimes we want to overindulge with our favorite foods and treats. But I want you to hear me whispering in your ear:

Hara... hachi... bu...

What was that? Did anyone else hear that? Is it the wind?

No. It’s me, Dr. B. I’m in your head. And I’m dropping off some mindful eating tips before I go.

The practice of mindful eating allows us to get back to mealtime fundamentals, like enjoying our food! 🙌

A few of my other favorite tips?

➡️ Enjoy meals with other people when possible
➡️ Schedule mealtimes
➡️ Avoid toxic hunger— don’t let hanger take over!

So if you find yourself in a position where you’re able to safely meet up with friends you haven’t seen for a meal, remember — eat until you’re 80% full, then STOP.

PS— I talk more about this in Chapter 9 of #FIBERFUELED. Have you checked it out? Link in bio to grab your copy.

https://theplantfedgut.com/book/
.
.
#fiberfueled #diversityofplants #eattherainbow #plants #plantbased #guthealth #guthealthmatters #guthealing #vegan #vegetarian #mindfuleating #harahachibu

node.text:
Let’s chat grains, shall we? 👋

The internet says all grains are inflammatory. ❌

But science says that consuming a shockingly small amount of whole grains (equivalent to two slices of bread) on a daily basis has the following effect on your RISK OF DEATH from these conditions.

Coronary heart disease ⬇️ 19%
Stroke ⬇️ 14%
Cardiovascular disease ⬇️ 29%
Cancer (any type) ⬇️ 15%
Respiratory disease ⬇️ 22%
Infectious diseases ⬇️ 26%
Diabetes ⬇️ 51%
Death from any cause ⬇️ 17%

By the way, this is coming from a systematic review and meta-analysis of 45 prospective cohort studies from 3 different continents and involving millions of patients. That’s about as high quality evidence as you’re going to find. 💁 (PMID: 27301975)

This is just one study. I’m more than happy to crack open Chapter 4 of FIBER FUELED and pull out some more. 📗

So where again is the evidence that whole grains are inflammatory???

I’m like Jerry Maguire, except instead of shouting “show me the money”, I’m yelling into my iPhone 11:

‼️ SHOW ME THE EVIDENCE!!!‼ ‼️

Of course, dropping the refined grains is the real message here. In a 6 week randomized trial, adding whole grains instead of refined grains led to bigger and more frequent dumps, healthier gut microbes, and more short chain fatty acids. 🙌 (PMID: 28179226)

Ultra-processed, ultra refined grains that remove the fiber and most other micronutrients and only keep the sugar or the starch are not doing any favors for your gut. Hopefully we can all hold hands and sing folk songs to that one. 🎶

If you haven’t checked out my book Fiber Fueled yet, now may be a good time to get the full download on this topic.

My favorite whole grain is farro. What’s yours???

https://theplantfedgut.com/book/
.
.

150 million hot dogs are bought/consumed on the 4th of July annually. 🌭

That means enough hot dogs are purchased for the 4th of July that you could link them from up from LA to Washington DC 5x over!

❗❗❗

To be honest, with the way Americans have become accustomed to eating, it’s not surprising. But I’m not casting stones at y’all! If you read Fiber Fueled, then you know that I was once a hot dog connoisseur. That was a family staple when I was a kid. But it wasn’t until I acknowledged that my diet was holding me back that I was able to ditch the dogs and get my health back.🤷

That’s why I’m presenting you today with a series of simple swaps you can make this weekend. 🙌 There are better options out there to get your gut microbes singing the Star Spangled Banner this weekend! Choosing Fiber Fueled plant-based products 🌱 when you can, and even making your own products like sauerkraut is WAY more beneficial for your gut and your health. Ultra processed products? Not so much. ❌

Speaking of, if you’re looking to level up your gut health and learn more about making healthy simple swaps, today is your LAST CHANCE to secure your spot in the LAST round of my Plant Fed Gut Masterclass in 2021!

If you’re committed to:

node.text:
I was talking to my patient about this today, minus the ride or die part, although this 83 year old woman probably would've liked it. 🤷

Nonetheless, she's a lovely person who has been suffering for far too long, more than 10 years. She deserves better, I desperately want her to be better. But she is carrying the weight of all that suffering on her back, feeling a mounting pressure to get answers immediately, feeling desperate to the point that if something doesn't work immediately then she wants to try something different. This was my first time meeting her. We're just getting started...

You can take two steps forward, two steps backward in 360 different directions, and after all that effort you're in the same place that you started. What she needs is rock 🪨 solid clarity on which direction to move 🧭, then the patience and persistence to move in that direction, celebrate small victories when they come 🎉, and recognize that if it’s the right direction you WILL ultimately get to your goal. 🙌

And I'm super optimistic that she will be better. But if you're not in the right headspace, then the anxiety and pressure will adversely affect your gut, worsening symptoms, and creating MORE anxiety and pressure. ❌  It's a vicious cycle.

Don't isolate parts of your body. You don't work that way. You are a whole person. When we elevate your mood, we improve your gut. When we improve your gut, we lift your mood. When we enhance both... we f%!@ing win! (Note: I'm wearing my game face here. Intense eye contact.💪🏻)

On Friday at noon ET, I'm hosting the world's expert on the mind-gut connection and the author of The Gut-Immune Connection Dr. @emeranmayer for a LIVE chat within The Plant Fed Gut Masterclass.

Registration is still open, but time is running short. Learn more at:
www.theplantfedgut.com/course

PS - Patient details altered to protect privacy.
.

“Intolerance of food is evidence of a damaged gut. We don’t see that in people with a healthy gut. There’s no test to prove that your gut is healthy, but when it’s healthy you’ll be able to eat in abundance and diversity without restriction and thrive!”

Gimme a 🙌🏻🙌🏻 if you can relate.

HAPPY WORLD MICROBIOME DAY!!!

Inside of us are 39 trillion microbes. Take our entire galaxy full of stars, shrink it down to an invisible size, and you would need to pack 100 of these galaxy’s into your colon to equal the number of microbes 🦠 you have inside of you right now!

I know this is hard to imagine because you can’t see them, but they’re like people. They have their personalities (some are grumpy), their own unique skill sets, and their own distinct food preferences.

And they’re super connected. They play a role in our digestion, immunity, metabolism, hormonal balance, mood and brain function. Yes, they are that powerful. And we need them to be healthy humans.

My goal is to help you guys fulfill your potential, optimize your microbiome, and move past food intolerances.

Tomorrow, I’m launching The Plant Fed Gut Masterclass for the last time in 2021. It’s a 7 week program to give you the knowledge to heal your body and optimize your gut microbiome.

This can be a summer of empowerment. Of shedding the restrictions and taking steps towards achieving your goals. Of tremendous personal growth.

I’m incredibly proud of the Masterclass. Audio lessons, video lessons, a workbook, recipes, weekly live sessions with me, a private Facebook group of likeminded people who help and support one another. By the way, the group is already awesome, I can tell it’s going to be a great summer.

Last time I ran the Masterclass, 98% of people said they would recommend it to a friend. But I’ve added even more… 

It’s going to be epic!

If you’re ready to make this happen, nows the time to register.
www.theplantfedgut.com/course

Back to World Microbiome Day. I never cease to be amazed…. I recently read a study about how our microbiome resembles our partners when we’re in a loving relationship. Fascinating.

What’s your favorite thing about these microbes?
